posts.name: Dallen Barnett
posts.cooked: Ok so basically I’m having a horrible time trying to figure out swerve this year, they changed a lot of stuff and I can’t make it work. I’m using the YAGSL example right now and it’s the closest anything has got to working but all the modules do is rotate as soon as I enable teleOp. Can someone please help me figure out what is wrong, I’m really stressing over this. Here is my code: GitHub - thelaw2457/TheLaw2457_Reefscape

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked: Video helps a ton, but with JUST a read of the CD post i suspect it is an inversion issue and the modules are never able to reach their setpoints.

posts.name: Dallen Barnett
posts.cooked: So if I invert stuff would that fix the problem of them not being able to reach their setpoints or is that something else I would have to figure out?

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
Maybe some unit conversations as well. But the inversions, when dne properly, will get everything running in the correct directions.

YAGSL documentation has a detailed when to invert page

Just don’t go randomly changing things if you are trouble shooting… That is a one way ticket to wasted time.

What physical hardware are your working with? Motors? Module manufacture? encoder manufacturer?

posts.name: jrz126
posts.cooked: there’s 3 sets of json config files in your code? how does it know which ones to use? Would start with this. verify the motors and encoders are mapped properly: https://docs.yagsl.com/bringing-up-swerve/check-your-motors

posts.name: Dallen Barnett
posts.cooked: I got NEOs on MK4 Swerve Modules with CANCoders, and a NavX2 gyro if that changes anything.

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked: Now that more software inclined folks have arrived I will defer to them.

posts.name: jrz126
posts.cooked: wheels spin in continuous circle? or oscillate back and forth? assuming all the feedbacks are coming in correctly. Try lowering your angle P gain. Your encoder angles seem pretty low. like a scaling issue. or radians vs degrees.

posts.name: Mike Taylor (he/him)
posts.cooked:
Are you seeing things similar to what we’re seeing?  Video in the third post of this thread.

Swerve wheels oscillating (YAGSL 2025 issue) Programming

posts.name: Dallen Barnett
posts.cooked: basically but mine is doing it way faster

posts.name: Dallen Barnett
posts.cooked: it’s mostly oscillating but i’ll look and see about lowering the p.

posts.name: Dallen Barnett
posts.cooked: I figured it out for the most part, I’m trying to use swerve modules from a few years back and they are a little wonky but they work pretty well. Changing the PID values fixed most of it but the back two still act a little weird but I think it’s a motor problem and not a code problem considering that the front two work fine. Thanks to all that helped!
We’re having the same problem. What PID values did you change exactly?(we have neos too)

posts.name: Dallen Barnett
posts.cooked: mostly P until it wasn’t being so horrible and then changed D
